schema:name: Long-term changes in the typical length of demersal fish communities in UK waters and surrounding areas, 1983 to 2020

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:author.schema:name: The Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic

schema:spatialCoverage: UK (Celtic Seas and Greater North Sea)
notes:
The assessment period differs depending on the survey, starting at the earliest in 1983 in one Greater North Sea subdivision and ending in either 2019 or 2020.

</br> The legend entries are defined as follows:

1. Long-term increase: an increase in the size of fish within the community over the period
2. No long-term change: no change in the size of fish
3. Long-term decrease: the size of fish in the community has decreased from an earlier period but has increased from a more recent period
4. Decrease to minimum observed state: the fish in the community are currently at the lowest size recorded
